prompt: <description>**CAD Model Generation Instructions** The final CAD model will be a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the object are approximately 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The object is centered in the image. **Part 1** Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The curved side has a radius of 0.5 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.3233, 0.194, 0.0] Create a sketch with a single face (face_1). On this face, draw a loop (loop_1) comprising of six lines. - Line 1: Start Point: [0.0, 0.0], End Point: [0.0388, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point: [0.0388, 0.0], End Point: [0.0388, 0.194] - Line 3: Start Point: [0.0388, 0.194], End Point: [0.4267, 0.194] - Line 4: Start Point: [0.4267, 0.194], End Point: [0.4267, 0.2328] - Line 5: Start Point: [0.4267, 0.2328], End Point: [0.0, 0.2328] - Line 6: Start Point: [0.0, 0.2328], End Point: [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.097 units and in the opposite direction by 0.097 units. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.4267. Use the 'NewBodyFeatureOperation' for this part. **Part 2** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The prism is centered on a white background. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.3233, 0.2586, 0.0] Create a sketch with a single face (face_1). On this face, draw a loop (loop_1) comprising of four lines. - Line 1: Start Point: [0.0, 0.0], End Point: [0.1293, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point: [0.1293, 0.0], End Point: [0.1293, 0.2328] - Line 3: Start Point: [0.1293, 0.2328], End Point: [0.0, 0.2328] - Line 4: Start Point: [0.0, 0.2328], End Point: [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.3233 units and in the opposite direction by 0 units. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.2328. Use the 'JoinFeatureOperation' for this part.</description>
